cloud_avg_cores_reserved.description_html:
The average number of cores reserved by VM's, weighted by wall hours.
Core Hours: The product of the number of cores assigned to a VM and its wall time, in hours.
Wall Time: The duration between the start and end times of an individual session.
cloud_avg_cores_reserved.name: Average Cores Reserved Weighted By Wall Hours

cloud_avg_memory_reserved.description_html:
The average amount of memory (in bytes) reserved by VM's, weighted by wall hours.
Wall Time: The duration between the start and end times of a VM.
cloud_avg_memory_reserved.name: Average Memory Reserved Weighted By Wall Hours

cloud_avg_rv_storage_reserved.description_html:
The average amount of root volume storage space (in bytes) reserved by VM's, weighted by wall hours.
Wall Time: The duration between the start and end times of an individual session.
cloud_avg_rv_storage_reserved.name: Average Root Volume Storage Reserved Weighted By Wall Hours

cloud_avg_wallduration_hours.aggregate_formula: COALESCE(SUM(CASE WHEN agg.instance_state_id = 1 THEN agg.wallduration ELSE 0 END) / SUM(CASE ${DATE_TABLE_ID_FIELD} WHEN ${MIN_DATE_ID} THEN agg.num_sessions_running ELSE agg.num_sessions_started END) / 3600.0, 0)
cloud_avg_wallduration_hours.timeseries_formula: COALESCE(CASE agg.instance_state_id WHEN 1 THEN SUM(agg.wallduration) / SUM(agg.num_sessions_running) / 3600.0 ELSE 0 END, 0)
cloud_avg_wallduration_hours.name: Wall Hours: Per Session
cloud_avg_wallduration_hours.description_html:
The average wall time that a session was running, in hours
Session: A session is defined as a discrete run of a virtual machine (VM) on a cloud resource; i.e. any start and stop of a VM. For example, if a single VM is stopped and restarted ten times in a given day, this would be counted as ten sessions for that day.
Start: A session start event is defined as the initial creation, resume from pause/suspension, or unshelving of a VM. In the event that no such event has been collected, the first heartbeat event (e.g. a state report) is treated as the start of a new session.
Stop: A session stop event is defined as a pause, shelving, suspension, or termination event of a VM.

cloud_core_time.description_html:
The total number of CPU Hours consumed by VM's
CPU Hours: The product of the number of cores assigned to a VM and its wall time, in hours.
cloud_core_time.name: CPU Hours: Total

cloud_num_sessions_ended.description_html:
The total number of sessions that were ended on a cloud resource. A session is ended when a VM is paused, shelved, stopped, or terminated on a cloud resource.
Session: A session is defined as a discrete run of a virtual machine (VM) on a cloud resource; i.e. any start and stop of a VM. For example, if a single VM is stopped and restarted ten times in a given day, this would be counted as ten sessions for that day.
Start: A session start event is defined as the initial creation, resume from pause/suspension, or unshelving of a VM. In the event that no such event has been collected, the first heartbeat event (e.g. a state report) is treated as the start of a new session.
Stop: A session stop event is defined as a pause, shelving, suspension, or termination event of a VM.
cloud_num_sessions_ended.name: Number of Sessions Ended

cloud_num_sessions_running.aggregate_formula: COALESCE(SUM(CASE ${DATE_TABLE_ID_FIELD} WHEN ${MIN_DATE_ID} THEN agg.num_sessions_running ELSE agg.num_sessions_started END), 0)
cloud_num_sessions_running.name: Number of Sessions Active
cloud_num_sessions_running.description_html:
The total number of sessions on a cloud resource.
Session: A session is defined as a discrete run of a virtual machine (VM) on a cloud resource; i.e. any start and stop of a VM. For example, if a single VM is stopped and restarted ten times in a given day, this would be counted as ten sessions for that day.
Start: A session start event is defined as the initial creation, resume from pause/suspension, or unshelving of a VM. In the event that no such event has been collected, the first heartbeat event (e.g. a state report) is treated as the start of a new session.
Stop: A session stop event is defined as a pause, shelving, suspension, or termination event of a VM.

cloud_num_sessions_started.description_html:
The total number of sessions started on a cloud resource. A session begins when a VM is created, unshelved, or resumes running on a cloud resource.
Session: A session is defined as a discrete run of a virtual machine (VM) on a cloud resource; i.e. any start and stop of a VM. For example, if a single VM is stopped and restarted ten times in a given day, this would be counted as ten sessions for that day.
Start: A session start event is defined as the initial creation, resume from pause/suspension, or unshelving of a VM. In the event that no such event has been collected, the first heartbeat event (e.g. a state report) is treated as the start of a new session.
Stop: A session stop event is defined as a pause, shelving, suspension, or termination event of a VM.
cloud_num_sessions_started.name: Number of Sessions Started

cloud_wall_time.description_html: The total wall time in which VM's were running, in hours
cloud_wall_time.name: Wall Hours: Total

cloud_core_utilization.description_html:
A percentage that shows how many core hours were reserved over a time period against how many core hours a resource had available during that time period.
Core Hours: The product of the number of cores assigned to a VM and its wall time, in hours.
Core Hours Available: The total number of core hours available for a time period. Calculated by taking the product of the number of cores available over a time period, number of days in a time period and the number of hours in a day.
cloud_core_utilization.aggregate_formula: COALESCE((SUM(agg.core_time) / (SELECT SUM(rsa.core_time_available) FROM modw_aggregates.resourcespecsfact_by_${AGGREGATION_UNIT} as rsa WHERE rsa.${AGGREGATION_UNIT}_id BETWEEN ${MIN_DATE_ID} AND ${MAX_DATE_ID} AND FIND_IN_SET(rsa.resource_id, GROUP_CONCAT(DISTINCT agg.host_resource_id)) <> 0)) * 100, 0)
cloud_core_utilization.timeseries_formula: COALESCE((SUM(agg.core_time) / (SELECT SUM(rf.core_time_available) FROM modw_aggregates.resourcespecsfact_by_${AGGREGATION_UNIT} rf WHERE rf.${AGGREGATION_UNIT}_id = agg.${AGGREGATION_UNIT}_id AND FIND_IN_SET(rf.resource_id, GROUP_CONCAT(DISTINCT agg.host_resource_id)) <> 0)) * 100, 0)
cloud_core_utilization.name: Core Hour Utilization
